definition[0]: to stop going up or down and continue at the same height
example[0]: After climbing steeply, the path levelled off.
example[1]: The plane levelled out at 30,000 feet.
definition[1]: to stop rising or falling and become steady
example[2]: Inflation has begun to level off.
definition[2]: to make something flat and smooth
definition[3]: to stop increasing or growing and become steady or continue at a fixed level
example[3]: Lower mortgage rates should help the market to level out.
example[4]: Short-term interest rates will level off later this year.
